meanings.definition: To discontinue a session of (a parliament or other legislative assembly) without dissolving it.
meanings.sent1: The Prime Minister prorogates the parliament until further notice.
meanings.sent2: The decision to prorogate the assembly was met with mixed reactions.
meanings.sent3: The speaker prorogated the meeting abruptly, leaving everyone puzzled.
meanings.sent4: The act of prorogating the council echoed through the chambers.
meanings.sent5: The power to prorogate lies with the head of the legislative body.

meanings.sent1: She prorogates her study sessions when feeling overwhelmed.
meanings.sent2: The company decided to prorogate the project deadline due to unforeseen circumstances.
meanings.sent3: He prorogated his dentist appointment, hoping the toothache would go away on its own.
meanings.sent4: The decision to prorogate the event caused a ripple effect on the schedule.
meanings.sent5: The student prorogated the assignment submission, thinking he had more time.
